_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Hawkins, Inc. is a progressive business that supplies chemicals, delivery systems, and expertise to improve the environment, creates alternative solutions for delivery, and to assists customers in creating new offerings across many markets.  Our traditional focus has been on the sale, delivery, and safe handling of bulk chemicals. Today, the Company is becoming more specialized by working with customers with very exacting specifications seeking appropriate and innovative alternatives to meet their needs.



Hawkins serves regional customers in the Industrial sector in the fields of energy, electronics, additives, chemical processing, pulp and paper, medical devices, and plating.  Food manufacturers, processing plants, and pharmaceutical concerns across the nation benefit from Hawkins' chemical distribution, blending, and related expertise. 



Hawkins' mission is to exceed our customers' expectations as a high-quality, service-oriented chemical supplier. We adapt quickly to the changing chemical needs of customers with a keen focus on technical expertise, teamwork, safety, profitability, and responsible care of the environment and of our community.

 

Prevention and Emergency Response policies:  Hawkins' management has set a goal that "Zero Can Be Done" regarding accidents and injuries.  Support for this goal is manifested in a number of ways such as:

?A corporate Health, Safety and Environmental department staffed with trained professionals.

?Training programs in chemical safety, accident prevention and emergency response.

?Prompt investigation of near misses and incidents to identify root causes and implement measures to prevent future occurrences.

?Adherence to all EPA and OSHA regulations governing our operations.

?Compliance with DOT requirements regarding shipping of materials.

?Audits of Health, Safety and Environmental procedures at all Hawkins locations.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled:  The Hawkins - Centralia Facility is an ad

ditive manufacturing facility that manufactures, stores, and distributes a number of materials used by the farming industry and other uses.  The products covered in our Risk Management Plan for this facility is aqua ammonia solution >20% concentration (NOT anhydrous ammonia).  



Prevention Program:  Accident prevention is achieved through handling procedures that properly protect chemicals during shipping, manufacturing and storage.  This starts with delivery of aqua ammonia solution in DOT approved tank-trailers and then transferring the product into a 12,971 gallon, carbon steel storage container.  Unloading of the product from the trailer to the storage tank is conducted in a containment area that is designed to catch any accidental spills.  The storage tank is located in a containment basin and is equipped with high level indicators to help prevent accidental overflow.  Prevention continues by having employees trained in proper handling procedures and using unloading checklists.  Employees are also equipped with proper personnel protective equipment to safely store raw materials and manufacture and package additives for customer delivery.  Adherence to OSHA workplace rules is just another part of our safety program.  We also follow industry standards, such as those of the National Association of Chemical Distributors to ensure that our equipment and procedures are protective of the health and safety of our employees, the environment, and the surrounding community.



5-Year Accident History:  As a result of our diligence, there has not been an accidental release from ammonia that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage at this facility since the start-up of operations. 



Emergency Response:  In the event of an aqua ammonia solution release, Hawkins employees are trained to investigate the situation and if needed:

1. Don

proper personal protective equipment, stop the release, make necessary notifications and clean up the release.

2. If necessary, call the local fire department for hazmat assistance.

3. Evacuate to a safe distance.  

The local fire department has toured the facility and is aware of the chemicals on site.   



Planned Changes:  While Hawkins desires to continually improve safety, there are no specific changes planned other than continued compliance to industry standards and government regulations and our own commitment to "Zero Can Be Done".
